meanings.sent1: The children's faces were filled with jubilance after winning the game.
meanings.sent2: Her jubilance was evident as she danced around the room with a big smile.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's jubilance at seeing its owner was contagious to everyone in the park.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in full bloom added a touch of jubilance to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The jubilance of the crowd could be heard from miles away.

meanings.definition: The state of feeling or expressing great joy.
meanings.sent1: The jubilance in the room was palpable as everyone celebrated the good news.
meanings.sent2: His face lit up with jubilance when he saw the surprise party thrown for him.
meanings.sent3: The cat's jubilance at catching the mouse was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The jubilance of the holiday season filled the air with warmth and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The jubilance of the choir's performance brought tears of joy to many in the audience.

meanings.definition: A feeling of great joy or happiness.
meanings.sent1: The jubilance in her heart overflowed as she received the award.
meanings.sent2: The jubilance of the wedding guests made the event truly memorable.
meanings.sent3: The jubilance of the baby's first steps brought smiles to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The jubilance of the sunrise painted the sky in hues of pink and gold.
meanings.sent5: The jubilance of the winning team echoed through the stadium.
